  • havoc.autoval.tests.bios_upgrade.bios_upgrade

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.bios_upgrade.bios_upgrade

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import json
import os

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.site_utils import SiteUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.system.system_config import SystemConfig
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.config_check import ConfigCheck

"""
  This script is used for bios/EC firmware update based on the parameters passed.
  The user is expected to place the tools used for upgrade in the path
  <site_settings-repository_dir>/bin/<server_model>/bios.
  The need to also extract any zip /
  tar file that contains the update tool or script and firmware binary

  The following parameters are passed to the script through json file.
    method - Refers to the upgrade method to use (inband or OOB)
    dev_type - Refers to the device to which udpate need to be performed
    upgrade_only - If set will only do a single upgrade to the "new_fw_ver"
    downgrade_only = If set will only do a single downgrade to the "old_fw_ver"
    json_file - json file with absolute path that has rest of parameters. If not
                set will try to find file based on dev_type and manufacturer.

    tool_name - Refers to the tool that performs upgrade (bin or script)
    new_fw_tool_path - Refers to the update tool for new fw
    old_fw_tool_path - Refers to the update tool for old fw
    fw_filepath - Refers to the path to the fimware binary files
    new_fw_file - Refers to the golder firmware binary file
    old_fw_file - Refers to the old firmware binary file
    new_fw_ver - Refers to the new firmware version
    old_fw_ver - Refers to the old firmware version
    new_me_ver - Refers to the new me firmware version
    old_me_ver - Refers to the old me firmware version
    fw_update_count - Refers to the number of update iterations requested

  We check the current firmware version installed to decide the firmware to
  be updated on the first iteration. We continue alternating between new
  and old firmware for the given number of fw_udpate_count.

  Before and after each iteration, we need to check BIOS functionality.

  afulnx_64/afulnx_64_fb :
  /P - Program main BIOS image
  /B - Program Boot Block
  /N - Program NVRAM
  /C - Destroy CMOS checksum
  /E - Program Embedded Controller Block
  /K - Program all non-critical blocks
  /X - Don't Check ROM ID
  /R - Preserve ALL SMBIOS structure during NVRAM programming
"""



[docs]class BiosUpgrade(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(BiosUpgrade, self).__init__()
        self.method = self.test_control['method']
        self.system_bios_log = self.test_control['system_bios_log']
        self.no_pcr_check = self.test_control.get('no_pcr_check', False)
        self.fw_update_count = self.test_control.get('fw_update_count', 1)
        self.json_file = self.test_control.get('json_file', None)
        self.boot_time_variance = self.test_control.get(
            'boot_time_variance', 30)
        self.msr_registers = self.test_control.get('msr_registers', None)
        self.downgrade_only = self.test_control.get('downgrade_only', False)
        self.upgrade_only = self.test_control.get('upgrade_only', False)
        self.me_util_check = self.test_control.get('me_util_check', False)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.update_type = None
        if "update_type" in self.test_control:
            self.update_type = self.test_control["update_type"].lower()
        if self.update_type == "ec":
            self.log_info("EC Upgrade Test")
        else:
            self.log_info("BIOS Upgrade Test")

        self.get_json_data(self.host, self.json_file)
        cycle_count = self.fw_update_count
        self.log_info("Target to upgrade %d times" % cycle_count)
        boot_time_failures = []

        file_dep, fw_ver, me_ver, tool_path = self.get_bios_info()

        pcr_val = []
        upgrade_method = self.method

        for n in range(0, cycle_count):
            file_select = n % 2
            _iter = n + 1
            self.log_info("Iteration %d - starting" % _iter)
            # Read model specific registers and compare between BIOS versions
            msr_before = self.host.bios.rdmsr()
            # Get bios_info using dmidecode
            bios_log_before = self.host.bios.get_bios_full_info()

            if self.system_bios_log:
                # Create acpi dump
                acpi_dump_before = os.path.join(
                    self.system_log_dir, "acpi_before_%s" % _iter
                )
                self.host.bios.create_acpi_dump(acpi_dump_before)
                # Create lspci dump
                lspci_dump_before = os.path.join(
                    self.system_log_dir, "lspci_before_%s" % _iter
                )
                self.log_info("Creating LSPCI dump at %s" % lspci_dump_before)
                self.host.create_lspci_info_dump(lspci_dump_before)
            # check the boot time for the system to compare after the bios fw
            # upgrade
            boot_time_before_upgrade = self.host.get_system_boot_time()
            bios_ver = self.get_current_bios_version()
            self.log_info(
                "Iter: %d version Current: %s %s Updating: %s"
                % (_iter, bios_ver, upgrade_method, fw_ver[file_select])
            )
            # Check if the dev_type is EC not Bios
            if upgrade_method == "inband":
                binary_file = file_dep[file_select]
                binary_name = os.path.basename(os.path.normpath(binary_file))
                _tool_path = tool_path[file_select]
                self.host.bios.bios_update(
                    binary_file, binary_name, _tool_path, self.tool_name
                )

            elif upgrade_method == "oob":
                self.host.oob.power_off()
                cmd = "./%s %s %s" % (
                    self.tool_name,
                    self.host.oob.oob_addr,
                    file_dep[file_select],
                )
                self.log_info("Running Command %s" % cmd)
                self.host.localhost.run(
                    cmd, timeout=1800, working_directory=tool_path[file_select]
                )
                self.validate_condition(
                    True,
                    "Flashing BIOS %s Completed - Power Cycling now..."
                    % fw_ver[file_select],
                )
                self.host.oob.power_on()

            else:
                self.validate_condition(
                    False, "Invalid input method: %s" % (upgrade_method)
                )
            bios_ver = self.get_current_bios_version()
            self.validate_equal(
                bios_ver,
                fw_ver[file_select],
                "Iter: %d version Expected: %s, Found: %s"
                % (_iter, fw_ver[file_select], bios_ver),
            )
            # check the boot time after the bios fw upgrade
            boot_time_after_upgrade = self.host.get_system_boot_time()
            # check the boot time difference for every upgrade iteration
            # so ignore iteration 0 as we cant collect the firmware load time
            # before flashing
            if n:
                diff = abs(boot_time_after_upgrade - boot_time_before_upgrade)
                if diff > self.boot_time_variance:
                    boot_time_failures.append(n)

            # Get the PCR value from the server for current and
            # previous bios version at first and second  iteration
            # and compare it against for rest of the iteration
            if not self.no_pcr_check:
                self.log_info("Get the PCR value of current BIOS version")
                if _iter < 3:
                    pcr0_current_bios_val = self.host.inband.get_pcr0(self.host)
                    pcr_val.append(pcr0_current_bios_val)
                self.log_info(
                    "Iter: %d version Current: %s PCR00: %s"
                    % (_iter, bios_ver, pcr_val[file_select])
                )
                get_pcr0_val = self.host.inband.get_pcr0(self.host)
                # Compare the PCR00 value
                self.validate_equal(
                    get_pcr0_val,
                    pcr_val[file_select],
                    "Verify BIOS flash is successful with correct PCR value",
                )
            if self.me_util_check:
                self.log_info("Get the ME version of current BIOS version")
                cur_me_ver = self.host.oob.get_me_fw_version()
                self.validate_equal(
                    cur_me_ver,
                    me_ver[file_select],
                    "Verify BIOS ME flash is successful with correct ME version",
                )

            cfg_init = SystemConfig.config_check(self.host)
            self.validate_condition(cfg_init, "Config check")
            # Get msr data and compare with older firmware
            msr_after = self.host.bios.rdmsr()
            diff = self.host.bios.get_diff_in_msr_groups(msr_before, msr_after)
            self.validate_empty_diff(diff, "Compare MSR values", raise_on_fail=False)
            # Get Bios full infomation and compare with older firmware data
            bios_log_after = self.host.bios.get_bios_full_info()
            self.diff_bios_dmidecode(
                bios_log_before,
                bios_log_after,
            )
            if self.system_bios_log:
                # Compare acpi dump after bios upgrade
                acpi_dump_after = os.path.join(
                    self.system_log_dir, "acpi_after_%s" % _iter
                )
                self.host.bios.create_acpi_dump(acpi_dump_after)
                if n:
                    acpi_diff = self.host.bios.compare_acpi_dump(
                        acpi_dump_before, acpi_dump_after
                    )
                    if acpi_diff:
                        self.log_info("Difference in acpi table dump is %s" % acpi_diff)
                        self.log_info("look at acpi dumps for comparision \n before_update: {} \n after_update: {}".format(acpi_dump_before, acpi_dump_after))
                # Compare lspci dump after bios upgrade
                lspci_dump_after = os.path.join(
                    self.system_log_dir, "lspci_after_%s" % _iter
                )
                self.log_info("Creating LSPCI dump at %s" % lspci_dump_after)
                self.host.create_lspci_info_dump(lspci_dump_after)
                lspci_diff = self.host.bios.compare_lspci_dump(
                    lspci_dump_before, lspci_dump_after
                )
                if lspci_diff:
                    self.log_info("Difference in lspci dump is %s" % lspci_diff)

            self.log_info("Iteration %d - complete" % _iter)

        if not self.downgrade_only and not self.upgrade_only:
            # Make sure we leave the system with the latest version
            bios_ver = self.get_current_bios_version()
            if not bios_ver == self.new_fw_ver:
                binary_file = self.new_fw_file
                binary_name = os.path.basename(os.path.normpath(binary_file))
                _tool_path = self.new_fw_tool_path
                self.host.bios.bios_update(
                    binary_file, binary_name, _tool_path, self.tool_name
                )

        self.validate_empty_list(
            boot_time_failures,
            "Check for boot time variance less than %s seconds"
            % (self.boot_time_variance),
        )



[docs]    def get_bios_info(self):
        new_fw_tool_abs = os.path.join(self.new_fw_tool_path, self.tool_name)
        old_fw_tool_abs = os.path.join(self.old_fw_tool_path, self.tool_name)

        if self.upgrade_only:
            # Use only new version
            file_dep = [self.new_fw_file, new_fw_tool_abs]
            fw_ver = [self.new_fw_ver]
            me_ver = [self.new_me_ver]
            tool_path = [self.new_fw_tool_path]
            self.log_info("Performing single upgrade to version {}".format(fw_ver[0]))
        elif self.downgrade_only:
            # Use only old version
            file_dep = [self.old_fw_file, old_fw_tool_abs]
            fw_ver = [self.old_fw_ver]
            me_ver = [self.old_me_ver]
            tool_path = [self.old_fw_tool_path]
            self.log_info("Performing single downgrade to version {}".format(fw_ver[0]))
        else:
            # Upgrade / downgrade validation
            file_dep = [
                self.new_fw_file,
                self.old_fw_file,
                new_fw_tool_abs,
                old_fw_tool_abs,
            ]
            fw_ver = [self.new_fw_ver, self.old_fw_ver]
            me_ver = [self.new_me_ver, self.old_me_ver]
            tool_path = [self.new_fw_tool_path, self.old_fw_tool_path]

            # if new firmware version is already present, swap update order
            bios_ver = self.get_current_bios_version()
            if bios_ver == self.new_fw_ver:
                file_dep = [
                    self.old_fw_file,
                    self.new_fw_file,
                    old_fw_tool_abs,
                    new_fw_tool_abs,
                ]
                fw_ver = [self.old_fw_ver, self.new_fw_ver]
                me_ver = [self.old_me_ver, self.new_me_ver]
                tool_path = [self.old_fw_tool_path, self.new_fw_tool_path]

        # Check if the files are are present
        for filename in file_dep:
            self.validate_condition(
                os.path.isfile(filename), "Check that file %s exists" % filename
            )

        return file_dep, fw_ver, me_ver, tool_path



[docs]    def get_current_bios_version(self):
        if self.update_type == "ec":
            bios_ver = self.host.bios.get_ec_ver(self.ec_version_tool)
        else:
            bios_ver = self.host.bios.get_bios_ver()
        return bios_ver



[docs]    def get_json_data(self, host, json_file):
        if not json_file:
            # User didn't specify where to load FW information from. Detect
            # automatically:
            manu = self.host.oob.get_manufacturer().lower()
            model = self.host.product_name.lower().replace(" ", "")
            filename = "bios_{}_{}_{}.json".format(self.method, model, manu)
            json_file = os.path.join(model, "bios", manu, filename)

        fw_path = SiteUtils().get_firmware_path()
        self.updateinfo_file = os.path.join(fw_path, json_file)
        self.log_info("Loading FW information from {}".format(self.updateinfo_file))
        # Parse the parameters to be used in this test from json file
        with open(self.updateinfo_file) as data_file:
            datadict = json.load(data_file)

        self.tool_name = datadict["tool_name"]
        fw_path = SiteUtils().get_firmware_path()
        self.new_fw_tool_path = os.path.join(fw_path, datadict["new_fw_tool_path"])
        self.old_fw_tool_path = os.path.join(fw_path, datadict["old_fw_tool_path"])
        self.fw_filepath = os.path.join(fw_path, datadict["fw_filepath"])
        self.new_fw_file = os.path.join(fw_path, datadict["new_fw_file"])
        self.old_fw_file = os.path.join(fw_path, datadict["old_fw_file"])
        self.new_fw_ver = datadict["new_fw_ver"]
        self.old_fw_ver = datadict["old_fw_ver"]
        self.new_me_ver = datadict["new_me_ver"]
        self.old_me_ver = datadict["old_me_ver"]
        if "dependency_path" in datadict:
            self.dependency_path = datadict["dependency_path"]
        else:
            self.dependency_path = None
        if "ec_version_tool" in datadict:
            self.ec_version_tool = datadict["ec_version_tool"]
        else:
            self.ec_version_tool = None



[docs]    def diff_bios_dmidecode(self, start_info, end_info):
        config_check = ConfigCheck()
        start_filtered = config_check.filter_dmidecode(start_info)
        end_filtered = config_check.filter_dmidecode(end_info)
        AutovalUtils.validate_equal(
            start_filtered,
            end_filtered,
            "bios dmidecode output comparison between two versions"
        )



[docs]    def copy_to_resultsdir(self, path, filename):
        cmd = "tar czfP %s.tgz %s" % (filename, path)
        self.host.run(cmd, timeout=30, working_directory=self.tmpdir)
        cmd = "cp %s.tgz %s" % (path, self.resultsdir)
        self.log_info("%s.tgz is copied to %s" % (filename, self.resultsdir))
        self.host.run(cmd)



[docs]    def cleanup(self):
        super(BiosUpgrade, self).cleanup(
            cfg_filter=["bios_settings", "bios_version", "me_version"],
            config_check=True,
            config_data=None,
        )




[docs]def main():
    test = BiosUpgrade()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
